title: Space Race
description: Welcome to the TuringLab Space Race!

components.text: Open the **Scratch Starter Project**
The starter project contains three basic levels, we can add more later

steps.description: First lets get the level set up by opening a starter project
steps.title: Setting up the race

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
		point in direction (90 v)
		go to x: (-190) y: (-150)
		forever 
			if <(distance to [mouse-pointer v])  > (5) > then
			point towards [mouse-pointer v]
			move (3) steps
			end
		end
components.text: Add the code to your spaceship
**Click the Green Flag** - Can you control your spaceship with your mouse?

steps.description: We will use our mouse to guide the spaceship
steps.title: controls

components.text: + We need a a second costume for when the spaceship is destroyed. **Clone** the spaceship costume and call one 'spaceship' and the other 'destroyed'
Click on your 'destroyed' costume, add some flames to the spaceship, you can use the select tool to break up the costume so it looks more destroyed

components.blocks:
if <touching color [#01FF55]?> then
			switch costume to [destroyed v]
			say [Booom!] for (1) secs
			switch costume to [spaceship v]
			point in direction (90 v)
			go to x: (-190) y: (-150)
		end
components.text: Add this code to your spaceship, **inside** the `forever` loop. The spaceship will now be destroyed if it touches a laser wall.
To make sure the spaceship starts off in one piece and not destroyed, add this code **before** your 'forever' loop.

steps.description: Let's make the spaceship explode when it crashes into a laser wall
steps.title: Losing the game

components.blocks:
broadcast [complete v] 
	 say [Wooo!] for (1) secs
	point in direction (90 v)
	go to x: (-190) y: (-150)
	 wait (1) secs
components.text: When the shaceship reaches the end of the level, reset it to the beginning of the next level

components.blocks:
when I receive [complete v]
	 next backdrop
components.text: Write this in your **Stage**, this will change the backdrop when the level is complete

steps.description: Add code so that if the spaceship is touching the purple landing area, the next level is started. It will be similar to the code you have written that checks if the spaceship is touching a laser wall.
steps.title: Completeing a level

components.blocks:
say [I Win!] for (2) secs
	stop [all v]
components.text: When the shaceship the final landing zone, the game is over

steps.description: The race is over when the spaceship reaches the final landing zone which is pink.
steps.title: Winning the game

components.text: + Add a new variable called `time` to your stage.

components.blocks:
when flag clicked
		set [time v] to [0]
		forever
			wait (0.1) secs
			change [time v] by (0.1)
		end
components.text: Add this code to your __stage__, so that the timer counts up until the ship reaches the landing zone

steps.description: Adding a timer to the game will let us keep track of our score
steps.title: Timer

components.text: + Lets add some boosts to make the spaceship go faster. Edit your stage backdrop and add in some red booster arrows.

components.blocks:
if <touching color [#FF0000]?> then
			move (4) steps
		end
components.text: Add this to the spaceship `forever` loop, so that it moves _extra_ steps when touching a red booster.
Try adding a moving laser gate. This should be the same colours as the walls. You can make it **spin** or move **side to side**
Set the center of the gate sprite.
Add code to your laser gate to make it either move side to side forever, or spin slowly forever.

steps.description: Lets make the game harder by some moving obstacles.
steps.title: Extensions

components.text: Add a new blackhole sprite by drawing spirals in different colors.
Give the blackhole a wirl effect, write this code in the **blackhole** sprite:

components.blocks:
if <touching color [blackhole v]?> then
			point towards [blackhole v]
			move (2) steps   
		end
components.text: Add this code **inside** your **spaceship** 'forever' loop

steps.description: Can you add more things to your game, you could add power ups or even black holes!
steps.title: More obstacles!

steps.description: Why not try making your own levels and add them to the game
steps.title: Add your own Levels
